reference_summary:
Death Row - A History of Capital Punishment in America - A 6-Part Documentary Series
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
['This hard-hitting 6-part documentary series on 2 discs, featuring interviews from experts in the field as well as archival footage, examines America\'s history with the death penalty: it\'s roots in frontier justice, the technologies that changed nooses and firing squads to electric chairs and lethal injections, the legal battles defining exactly what is "cruel and unusual punishment", the ceremonial aspect of requested "last meals", and some of the most notorious killers who met it as a final end']
{'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.12 Ounces', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '5 hours and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 2, 2016', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'Centre Communication', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Can be very informative. Some points should've been more in depth, but overall it is an informative and entertaining documentary if you are interested in the history of the subject.
Informative
The Stanford Prison Experiment [Blu-ray]
Billy Crudup  (Actor),     Ezra Miller  (Actor),     Kyle Patrick Alvarez  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
['What happens when a college psych study goes shockingly wrong? Based on the notorious true story, THE STANFORD PRISON EXPERIMENT stars Billy Crudup (Watchmen) as Stanford University professor Dr. Philip Zimbardo, who, in 1971, cast 24 student volunteers as prisoners and guards in a simulated jail to examine the source of abusive behavior in the prison system. The results astonished the world, as participants went from middle-class undergrads to drunk-with-power sadists and submissive victims in just a few days. Featuring an extraordinary cast including Ezra Miller, Olivia Thirlby, Tye Sheridan, Keir Gilchrist, Michael Angarano, and Thomas Mann, and created with the close participation of Dr. Zimbardo himself, THE STANFORD PRISON EXPERIMENT is a chilling, edge-of-your-seat thriller about the dark side of power and the effects of imprisonment.']
{'Genre': 'Action & Adventure/Thrillers', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Ezra Miller, Moises Arias, Billy Crudup, Gaius Charles, Kyle Patrick Alvarez, Tye Sheridan', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 2 minutes', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '35224399', 'Director': 'Kyle Patrick Alvarez', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 2 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 12, 2016', 'Actors': 'Billy Crudup, Ezra Miller, Tye Sheridan, Gaius Charles, Moises Arias', 'Studio': 'IFC Independent Film', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Interesting concept and film, but feels at points like it's dragging or was extended to make a certain time or length for the film. Acting is very good and keeps the viewer's attention even as the film hits some points that would otherwise lose the viewer's attention.
Interesting
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Liza Johnson'], 'Producers': ['Holly Wiersma', 'Cassian Elwes', 'Cary Elwes'], 'Starring': ['Michael Shannon', 'Kevin Spacey', 'Alex Pettyfer'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']}
Kevin Spacey does a really good job of being Nixon.  Michael Shannon does a good job of playing Elvis once you're able to get over the fact that he doesn't look too much like him. It took me a little while to get over that at the beginning of the movie, but once I did I enjoyed the movie. It is an intriguing subject for a movie, and the idea of what could or may have happened keeps you interested. Overall it is an entertaining movie.
Kevin Spacey does a really good job of being Nixon

The Call (Two Disc Combo: Blu-ray / DVD)
Halle Berry  (Actor),     Abigail Breslin  (Actor),     Brad Anderson  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
['In this heart-pounding, edge-of-your-seat thriller, veteran 911 operator Jordan (Academy Award® Winner Halle Berry, Monster’s Ball, 2001) takes a life-altering call from a teenage girl (Academy Award® nominee Abigail Breslin, Little Miss Sunshine, 2006) who has been kidnapped and thrown into the trunk of a madman’s car. But with the clock ticking, Jordan soon realizes she must confront a killer from her past to put an end to a serial killer’s haunting rampage. Also starring Morris Chestnut.']

I really liked the cast and the idea, but felt like the way the movie was contained into a few rooms throughout the whole movie hurt the overall experience. Some movies can benefit from this effect of claustrophobia or limited environment, but I feel like this one didn't, and the cast is what kept it afloat.
Decent movie
The Walk (3D Blu-ray + Blu-ray)
Joseph Gordon-Levitt  (Actor),     Ben Kingsley  (Actor),     Robert Zemeckis  (Director, Producer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
['Twelve people have walked on the moon, but only one man – Philippe Petit (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) – has ever walked in the immense void between the World Trade Center towers. Guided by his real-life mentor, Papa Rudy (Ben Kingsley), and aided by an unlikely band of international recruits, Petit and his gang overcome long odds, betrayals, dissension, and countless close calls to conceive and execute their mad plan. Academy Award-winning director Robert Zemeckis uses advanced technology in the service of an emotional, character-driven story. THE WALK is a love letter to Paris and New York City in the 1970s, but most of all, to the Towers of the World Trade Center.']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interest in Documentaries and Thematic Films:** The user continues to prefer documentaries and films with historical and psychological themes, particularly those that delve into social experiments and societal complexities.

- **Engagement with Diverse Genres:** Their openness to thrillers and suspenseful narratives remains strong, showcasing a willingness to explore various genres while prioritizing quality storytelling.

- **Desire for In-depth Content:** They value comprehensive analysis in content, favoring narratives that stimulate thought and provide deep insights across genres.

- **Balanced Enjoyment:** The user appreciates strong performances and innovative concepts, evidenced by their recent rating of 3.0 for a suspenseful film that they found engaging but noted became slow at moments. This reflects a nuanced enjoyment balanced with the expectation for heightened storytelling.

- **Critical Engagement:** They maintain a discerning perspective on narrative structures, placing significant importance on the environment in storytelling. Their reviews consistently express a desire for films to realize their thematic and narrative potential fully.

- **Mixed Ratings:** The user typically rates between 3.0 and 4.0, demonstrating a sophisticated appreciation for media quality. Their recent interactions indicate a critical eye, often reflecting on the execution relative to expectations.

Overall, the user remains dedicated to consuming thought-provoking media, especially those that successfully combine suspense with intricate narratives, while maintaining high standards concerning execution and depth.
